questions.question: What is the title of the research article with DOI 10.1021/ja9641620?
questions.answer: Spin Density Maps for the Ferrimagnetic Chain Compound MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O (pba = 1,2-Propylenebis(oxamato)): Polarized Neutron Diffraction and Theoretical Studies

questions.question: Who are the authors of the study on the spin density maps for the ferrimagnetic chain compound MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O?
questions.answer: Valéry Baron, Béatrice Gillon, Alain Cousson, Corine Mathonière, Olivier Kahn, André Grand, Lars Öhrström, Bernard Delley, Michel Bonnet, Jean-Xavier Boucherle

questions.question: What method was primarily used in the study DOI 10.1021/ja9641620 to determine the experimental magnetic structure factors F_M?
In the study with DOI 10.1021/ja9641620, how does the spin density distribution compare between the MnCu binuclear compound and the MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O ferrimagnetic chain?
questions.answer: The spin density is more diffuse on the copper side for both compounds, but the sums of positive and negative atomic spin populations are different, with the chain compound having higher values.

questions.question: True or False: The study DOI 10.1021/ja9641620 found that the antiferromagnetic interaction is more pronounced through the oxamido group than through the oxamato group.
What was the main conclusion regarding the spin density maps for the MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O ferrimagnetic chain compound as per the study DOI 10.1021/ja9641620?
questions.answer: The spin density map provides a detailed description of the ground state for the molecular magnetic system, showing large positive spin density on the manganese side and weak negative density on the copper side.

questions.question: True or False: According to the study DOI 10.1021/ja9641620, the spin delocalization is more significant for the MnCu binuclear compound than for the MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O ferrimagnetic chain compound.
What role does the temperature play in the synthesis of MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O as described in the study with DOI 10.1021/ja9641620?
questions.answer: The temperature of 50 °C plays a crucial role in the size of the single crystals obtained.

questions.question: True or False: The study with DOI 10.1021/ja9641620 utilized Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations to compare theoretical and experimental spin populations.
How does the experimental magnetization at 10 K under 50 kOe for MnCu(pba)(H2O)3·2H2O compare to the total induced moment per MnCu unit derived from refinement in the study DOI 10.1021/ja9641620?
questions.answer: The experimental magnetization at 10 K under 50 kOe is 3.6 μB, which is somewhat higher than the derived moment of 3.2(1) μB from refinement.
